awd_titl_txt: Synthesis and Reactivity of Low Valent Transition Metal     Imido Complexes
awd_abstract_narration: This Research Opportunities for Women Research Planning Grant is                in the general area of inorganic, bioinorganic, and                             organometallic chemistry and in the subfields of synthetic and                  physical inorganic chemistry.  During the twelve month period                   beginning 1 July 1989, Professor Bruce will conduct preliminary                 experiments to assist in delineating how the structure at the                   nitrogen center in imido complexes influences their reactivity.                 Her Research Planning Grant pursuits will focus on the synthesis                of imido complexes of coordinately saturated metals in which the                imido ligand lone pair remains nonbonding.  These activities                    should contribute to Professor Bruce's establishing a                           competitive, independent research program in her laboratory at                  the University of Maine.                                                                                                                                        The research area that will be explored in this project is of                   potential importance in organic synthesis and in catalytic and                  biological processes.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
